questions.text: A newborn present with treatment-resistant congestive heart failure, a bulging anterior fontanelle, a bruit upon auscultation, and a transfontanellar ultrasound as shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vein of Galen malformation should be considered in neonates with resistant congestive heart failure, bulging fontanelle, and bruit on auscultation, especially if imaging reveals a midline mass with ventricular dilation. This vascular anomaly requires specific neurosurgical and medical intervention to manage the high-output cardiac failure and potential hydrocephalus.
  • ➤ Vein of Galen malformation should be considered in neonates with resistant congestive heart failure, bulging fontanelle, and bruit on auscultation, especially if imaging reveals a midline mass with ventricular dilation.
  • ➤ This vascular anomaly requires specific neurosurgical and medical intervention to manage the high-output cardiac failure and potential hydrocephalus.

questions.text: A 25-year-old patient presented with multiple pin pointed dome shaped skin lesions over hands as shown in the image below. What is true about the diagnosis of the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: It’s a form of ID reaction

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of Wickhams striae is classical for this condition

questions.correct_answer: D. Mucous membrane is not involved
questions.explanation:
Ans. D

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lichen nitidus is characterized by numerous small, shiny papules primarily on the skin, with the mucous membranes generally not involved .
  • ➤ Lichen nitidus is characterized by numerous small, shiny papules primarily on the skin, with the mucous membranes generally not involved .
  • ➤ Lichen nitidus
  • ➤ small, shiny papules
  • ➤ mucous membranes
  • ➤ not involved

questions.text: In the context of the National Tuberculosis Elimination Program (NTEP), how is a high priority TB-HIV district defined based on the criteria set for integrating TB and HIV control measures?

options.label: A
options.text: More than 10% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

options.label: B
options.text: More than 12% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

options.label: C
options.text: More than 15% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

options.label: D
options.text: More than 20% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

questions.correct_answer: A. More than 10% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) More than 10% of the TB patients tested for HIV in the district are known to be HIV positive.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Categorisation of Districts under NTEP (for HIV-TB Co-infection)
  • ➤ Categorisation of Districts under NTEP (for HIV-TB Co-infection)

questions.text: An 18-year-old girl presents to the gynecology outpatient department with amenorrhea. On examination, she exhibits Tanner Stage V breast development but lacks pubic and axillary hair. Ultrasound reveals an absent uterus and non-developed gonads. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ AIS is a condition where an individual who is genetically male (46,XY) is resistant to male hormones (androgens).
  • ➤ AIS is a condition where an individual who is genetically male (46,XY) is resistant to male hormones (androgens).

questions.text: During a routine review of medicolegal cases, a medical officer at a district hospital is tasked with analyzing a case involving a healthcare professional charged with criminal negligence following a patient's adverse outcome post-surgery. In preparing a report on the case, the medical officer delves into potential legal defences that might be employed by the healthcare professional. The officer is particularly focused on distinguishing which defences are typically not valid in cases of criminal negligence within the medical context. Which of the following is NOT considered a valid legal defence against charges of criminal negligence in the medical field?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Contributory negligence

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Contributory negligence – both patient and doctor are at fault. A defense for doctor only in civil negligence, but the onus to proof will lie on Doctor. Two Doctrines are related to contributory negligence –
  • ➤ Contributory negligence – both patient and doctor are at fault. A defense for doctor only in civil negligence, but the onus to proof will lie on Doctor.
  • ➤ Contributory negligence
  • ➤ Two Doctrines are related to contributory negligence –
  • ➤ a) Last clear chance Doctrine”: Even after the contributory negligence has occurred, the “Doctor” still had the last chance to avoid complications. Here the doctor cannot take the defense.
  • ➤ Last clear chance Doctrine”:
  • ➤ b) Avoidable consequences rule”: Even after the contributory negligence has occurred, the “Patient” had the last chance to avoid complications by timely informing the doctor. Here doctor can take the defense
  • ➤ Avoidable consequences rule”:

questions.text: A hospital infection control specialist is reviewing data on nosocomial infections related to intravascular catheters. Which species of Pseudomonas is most commonly associated with causing intravascular catheter-related infections?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pseudomonas aeruginosa is most troublesome agent of nosocomial infections
  • ➤ Pseudomonas aeruginosa is most troublesome agent of nosocomial infections

questions.text: Statement A : The migratory motor complex of the gastrointestinal tract will get repeated every 60 min Statement B : The migratory motor complex will be inactive during fasting periods Which one of the following statement is Accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: The Statement A is True, the Statement B is False

options.label: B
options.text: The Statement A is False, the Statement B is True

options.label: C
options.text: Both the Statements A and B are True

options.label: D
options.text: Both the Statements A and B are False

questions.correct_answer: D. Both the Statements A and B are False
questions.explanation:
Ans. D

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The Migratory Motor Complex (MMC) or Migratory Myoelectric Complex will be active during the interdigestive periods and also during fasting The Gastrointestinal Hormone Motilin (from M 0 cells ) will be involved in the initiation of migratory motor complex These cycles of motor activity will migrate from the stomach to the distal ileum (in the aboral direction ) The entire cycle gets repeated every 90-100 min (not 60 min)
  • • The Migratory Motor Complex (MMC) or Migratory Myoelectric Complex will be active during the interdigestive periods and also during fasting
  • • Migratory Motor Complex
  • • Migratory Myoelectric Complex
  • • active
  • • interdigestive periods
  • • during fasting
  • • The Gastrointestinal Hormone Motilin (from M 0 cells ) will be involved in the initiation of migratory motor complex
  • • Gastrointestinal Hormone Motilin
  • • M 0 cells
  • • initiation
  • • migratory motor complex
  • • These cycles of motor activity will migrate from the stomach to the distal ileum (in the aboral direction )
  • • motor activity
  • • migrate
  • • stomach
  • • distal ileum
  • • aboral direction
  • • The entire cycle gets repeated every 90-100 min (not 60 min)
  • • entire cycle
  • • repeated
  • • 90-100 min

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Migratory Motor Complex (MMC) typically occurs in cycles of about 90 to 120 minutes , not 60 minutes, and is active during fasting periods to clear the gastrointestinal tract of undigested material .
  • ➤ The Migratory Motor Complex (MMC) typically occurs in cycles of about 90 to 120 minutes , not 60 minutes, and is active during fasting periods to clear the gastrointestinal tract of undigested material .
  • ➤ Migratory Motor Complex (MMC)
  • ➤ cycles
  • ➤ about 90 to 120 minutes
  • ➤ active during fasting periods
  • ➤ clear
  • ➤ gastrointestinal tract
  • ➤ undigested material

questions.text: A researcher is examining three different population samples to estimate the average effect of a new drug. The graph presents three normal distributions of sample means with varying sample sizes: 1 (n = 1000), 2 (n = 800), and 3 (n = 600). Based on the information provided, which order correctly represents the margin of error from greatest to least among the three samples?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 3>2>1

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Margin of Error: Amount of random sampling error in a survey’s results Margin of error is simply the “radius” (or half the width) of a confidence interval Margin of error = Critical value × Standard error Standard error is inversely related to sample size (SEmean = SD/√Sample size) Margin of error is inversely related to the Sample size
  • ➤ Margin of Error: Amount of random sampling error in a survey’s results
  • ➤ Margin of error is simply the “radius” (or half the width) of a confidence interval
  • ➤ Margin of error = Critical value × Standard error
  • ➤ Standard error is inversely related to sample size (SEmean = SD/√Sample size)
  • ➤ Margin of error is inversely related to the Sample size

questions.text: In a patient undergoing cancer treatment, which protein is associated with Microtubule Organizing Centers (MTOCs) that becomes a key target due to its crucial role in cell division, making it a promising target for chemotherapy?

  • ➤ Inhibiting tubulin can prevent cancer cells from successfully dividing, thereby reducing tumor growth and progression.

Various Central Acts like Prevention of Food Adulteration Act 1954, Milk and Milk Products Order 1992, etc. to be repealed. Single reference point for all matters relating to food safety and standards Establishment of the Authority: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India is the Administrative Ministry for the implementation of FSSAI

questions.text: A 9-year-old patient is brought to the emergency department with a supracondylar humerus fracture following a fall from a tree. questions.explanation:
Ans.

questions.text: Identify the correct agent-disease pairings from the list provided: Lyme disease — Borrelia burgdorferi Cat-scratch disease — Bartonella henselae Glanders — Burkholderia mallei Rat bite fever — Borrelia recurrentis Trench fever — Bartonella bacilliformis

questions.text: Which of the following is considered an advantage of performing a hysterectomy in the case of a molar pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: It completely eliminates the chance of developing choriocarcinoma.

options.label: B
options.text: Postoperative follow-up is no longer required.

options.label: C
options.text: It allows for the simultaneous removal of any enlarged ovaries.

options.label: D
options.text: It minimizes the risk of pulmonary embolism.

questions.correct_answer: D. It minimizes the risk of pulmonary embolism.
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Monitoring hCG levels post-hysterectomy is critical in ensuring all molar tissue has been addressed and to prevent or identify the development of gestational trophoblastic neoplasia, such as choriocarcinoma.
  • ➤ Monitoring hCG levels post-hysterectomy is critical in ensuring all molar tissue has been addressed and to prevent or identify the development of gestational trophoblastic neoplasia, such as choriocarcinoma.

questions.text: A pediatrician is evaluating the appropriate steps for managing non-immunized individuals who have been in contact with a confirmed case of diphtheria. Which of the following interventions are not recommended in this scenario? Prophylactic penicillin Single dose of toxoid Daily throat examination Daily throat swab culture Weekly throat swabs examination
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 2,4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Management of diphtheria contacts Immunisation: If primary immunization or booster was received in previous 2 years: No further action If primary immunization or booster was received more than 2 years ago: 1 booster dose If unimmunized contact: Active immunization + 1000-2000 units Antitoxin + Prophylactic penicillin/Erythromycin Examination: Physical examination: Daily for 1 week after exposure Throat swabbing: Weekly for several
  • ➤ Management of diphtheria contacts Immunisation: If primary immunization or booster was received in previous 2 years: No further action If primary immunization or booster was received more than 2 years ago: 1 booster dose If unimmunized contact: Active immunization + 1000-2000 units Antitoxin + Prophylactic penicillin/Erythromycin Examination: Physical examination: Daily for 1 week after exposure Throat swabbing: Weekly for several
  • ➤ Management of diphtheria contacts
  • ➤ Immunisation: If primary immunization or booster was received in previous 2 years: No further action If primary immunization or booster was received more than 2 years ago: 1 booster dose If unimmunized contact: Active immunization + 1000-2000 units Antitoxin + Prophylactic penicillin/Erythromycin Examination: Physical examination: Daily for 1 week after exposure Throat swabbing: Weekly for several
  • ➤ Immunisation: If primary immunization or booster was received in previous 2 years: No further action If primary immunization or booster was received more than 2 years ago: 1 booster dose If unimmunized contact: Active immunization + 1000-2000 units Antitoxin + Prophylactic penicillin/Erythromycin
  • ➤ If primary immunization or booster was received in previous 2 years: No further action If primary immunization or booster was received more than 2 years ago: 1 booster dose If unimmunized contact: Active immunization + 1000-2000 units Antitoxin + Prophylactic penicillin/Erythromycin
  • ➤ If primary immunization or booster was received in previous 2 years: No further action
  • ➤ If primary immunization or booster was received more than 2 years ago: 1 booster dose
  • ➤ If unimmunized contact: Active immunization + 1000-2000 units Antitoxin + Prophylactic penicillin/Erythromycin
  • ➤ Examination: Physical examination: Daily for 1 week after exposure Throat swabbing: Weekly for several
  • ➤ Physical examination: Daily for 1 week after exposure Throat swabbing: Weekly for several
  • ➤ Physical examination: Daily for 1 week after exposure
  • ➤ Throat swabbing: Weekly for several

questions.text: A 27-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after a motor vehicle accident. He is unconscious with signs of head injury. The initial assessment reveals papilledema. In preparing to intubate the patient for airway protection, the medical team should not choose which anesthetic agent?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the management of an unconscious patient with head injury and raised ICP, ketamine has traditionally been contraindicated due to concerns over increasing ICP, although this stance may be evolving with new evidence. It's essential to choose anesthetic agents that maintain cerebral perfusion and do not exacerbate intracranial hypertension.
  • ➤ In the management of an unconscious patient with head injury and raised ICP, ketamine has traditionally been contraindicated due to concerns over increasing ICP, although this stance may be evolving with new evidence.
  • ➤ It's essential to choose anesthetic agents that maintain cerebral perfusion and do not exacerbate intracranial hypertension.

questions.text: A commercial sex worker has come forward with a hard, painless sore on the vulva and accompanying painless swelling in the inguinal lymph nodes. What statement is FALSE regarding the likely condition?

options.label: A
options.text: The causative organism shows corkscrew motility

options.label: C
options.text: Extragenital syphilitic chancre can occur on the fingers

options.label: D
options.text: Dory flop sign can be seen in uncircumcised males

questions.correct_answer: B. The incubation period is 2-5 days
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presentation of a painless genital ulcer and painless lymphadenopathy suggests primary syphilis, where the causative organism shows corkscrew motility and the incubation period is longer than 2-5 days, typically around three weeks. Understanding the signs, symptoms, and characteristics of syphilis is important for proper diagnosis and treatment.
  • ➤ The presentation of a painless genital ulcer and painless lymphadenopathy suggests primary syphilis, where the causative organism shows corkscrew motility and the incubation period is longer than 2-5 days, typically around three weeks.
  • ➤ Understanding the signs, symptoms, and characteristics of syphilis is important for proper diagnosis and treatment.

questions.text: Based on the current understanding of HPV-associated conditions, which of the following can result from an HPV infection? Cervical cancer Anal cancer Oropharyngeal cancer Laryngeal papillomatosis
questions.explanation:

  • ➤ HPV-related Cancers Cervical cancer (HPV 16,18) Oropharyngeal cancers (HPV 16) Genital warts (HPV 6,11) Laryngeal papillomatosis (HPV 6,11) Anal cancer Penile cancer Vaginal cancer Vulvar cancer
  • ➤ HPV-related Cancers
  • ➤ Cervical cancer (HPV 16,18) Oropharyngeal cancers (HPV 16) Genital warts (HPV 6,11) Laryngeal papillomatosis (HPV 6,11) Anal cancer Penile cancer Vaginal cancer Vulvar cancer
  • ➤ Cervical cancer (HPV 16,18)
  • ➤ Oropharyngeal cancers (HPV 16)
  • ➤ Genital warts (HPV 6,11)
  • ➤ Laryngeal papillomatosis (HPV 6,11)
  • ➤ Anal cancer
  • ➤ Penile cancer
  • ➤ Vaginal cancer
  • ➤ Vulvar cancer

questions.text: During a hysteroscopy, a surgeon is performing a diagnostic evaluation on a 35-year-old woman for abnormal uterine bleeding. The procedure involves the introduction of fluid into the uterine cavity to expand it and improve visibility. The surgeon is mindful of the volume and type of fluid used, as well as the patient's fluid balance. Understanding the significance of fluid management during this procedure, which of the following is the most critical reason for careful fluid monitoring during hysteroscopy?

options.label: A
options.text: Leakage of fluid into the peritoneal cavity leading to peritonitis

options.label: C
options.text: Fluids running out during the procedure

questions.correct_answer: D. Electrolyte imbalance in the patient
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Electrolyte imbalance in the patient

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The primary objective of careful fluid management during hysteroscopy is to prevent electrolyte imbalances in the patient, such as hyponatremia, which can occur due to the absorption of irrigation fluids into the bloodstream. Understanding the implications of fluid absorption and the potential for fluid overload is essential for the safe conduct of hysteroscopic procedures.
  • ➤ The primary objective of careful fluid management during hysteroscopy is to prevent electrolyte imbalances in the patient, such as hyponatremia, which can occur due to the absorption of irrigation fluids into the bloodstream.
  • ➤ Understanding the implications of fluid absorption and the potential for fluid overload is essential for the safe conduct of hysteroscopic procedures.

questions.text: During the process of evaluating protein concentration in a laboratory setting, which of the following amino acids is primarily responsible for the absorption of ultraviolet light at a wavelength of 280 nm, allowing for the spectrophotometric analysis of protein solutions?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The properties of aromatic amino acids, specifically tryptophan, allows them to absorb ultraviolet light. This absorption is utilized in laboratory techniques to analyze and quantify protein concentrations.
  • ➤ The properties of aromatic amino acids, specifically tryptophan, allows them to absorb ultraviolet light.
  • ➤ This absorption is utilized in laboratory techniques to analyze and quantify protein concentrations.

questions.text: A medical researcher is comparing the distribution of systolic blood pressure readings between two different groups of patients. The researcher creates a Box and Whisker plot for each group. If Group A's plot shows a median closer to the third quartile with longer whiskers on the lower end, while Group B's plot has a median closer to the first quartile and longer upper whiskers, what can be inferred about the blood pressure readings between the two groups?

options.label: A
options.text: Group A has higher systolic blood pressure readings with greater variability on the lower end.

options.label: B
options.text: Group A has a symmetrical distribution of systolic blood pressure readings.

options.label: C
options.text: Group B has a positively skewed distribution of systolic blood pressure readings.

options.label: D
options.text: Group B has lower systolic blood pressure readings with greater variability on the lower end.

questions.correct_answer: C. Group B has a positively skewed distribution of systolic blood pressure readings.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Group B has a positively skewed distribution of systolic blood pressure readings.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Box and Whisker Plot’ Sides of boxes represent Quartiles 1st and 3rd; Line inside the Box is 2nd Quartile (Median) Whiskers on the side represent Minimum and Maximum value If Median line (Q2) in exact centre of box, Its bilaterally symmetrical Normal distribution But if Median line is towards a side of the box, Its skewed distribution
  • ➤ Box and Whisker Plot’ Sides of boxes represent Quartiles 1st and 3rd; Line inside the Box is 2nd Quartile (Median) Whiskers on the side represent Minimum and Maximum value
  • ➤ Sides of boxes represent Quartiles 1st and 3rd; Line inside the Box is 2nd Quartile (Median) Whiskers on the side represent Minimum and Maximum value
  • ➤ Sides of boxes represent Quartiles 1st and 3rd; Line inside the Box is 2nd Quartile (Median)
  • ➤ Whiskers on the side represent Minimum and Maximum value
  • ➤ If Median line (Q2) in exact centre of box, Its bilaterally symmetrical Normal distribution But if Median line is towards a side of the box, Its skewed distribution
  • ➤ But if Median line is towards a side of the box, Its skewed distribution
  • ➤ But if Median line is towards a side of the box, Its skewed distribution

questions.text: A cardiologist is reviewing the electrocardiogram of a patient who is experiencing irregular heartbeats. They focus on the repolarization phase of the action potential. Which ionic movement is responsible for phase 3 of the cardiac action potential?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Potassium efflux (K+ efflux)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The repolarization phase of the cardiac action potential, phase 3, is dominated by the efflux of potassium ions, which leads to the restoration of the resting membrane potential of cardiac muscle cells.
  • ➤ The repolarization phase of the cardiac action potential, phase 3, is dominated by the efflux of potassium ions, which leads to the restoration of the resting membrane potential of cardiac muscle cells.

questions.text: An 18-year-old boy presents to the psychiatry outpatient department complaining that he feels as if he has changed from the inside. He describes feeling strange and different from his normal self, expressing significant tension and anxiety but is unable to specify exactly what has changed. This phenomenon is best described as:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Depersonalization involves a disruption in how one perceives or experiences their sense of self and can be distressing, particularly in the absence of other psychotic symptoms such as clear delusions or hallucinations.
  • ➤ Depersonalization involves a disruption in how one perceives or experiences their sense of self and can be distressing, particularly in the absence of other psychotic symptoms such as clear delusions or hallucinations.

questions.text: During a hysterosalpingography, a patient's fallopian tubes appear beaded with clubbing of the fimbrial end and the ampulla. What is the most likely cause of this finding?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The characteristic appearance of beaded fallopian tubes with clubbing of the fimbrial ends and ampulla, as observed during hysterosalpingography, is highly indicative of tubal tuberculosis.
  • ➤ The characteristic appearance of beaded fallopian tubes with clubbing of the fimbrial ends and ampulla, as observed during hysterosalpingography, is highly indicative of tubal tuberculosis.

questions.text: A cardiologist is assessing a patient's functional capacity related to heart disease using the New York Heart Association (NYHA) Functional Classification. The patient reports an inability to perform any physical activity without discomfort. Which NYHA class does this symptom correspond to?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) New York Heart Association 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ New York Heart Association (NYHA) Classification Importance: Scale used for quantification of degree of functional limitation imposed by Congestive health failure (CHF)
  • ➤ New York Heart Association (NYHA) Classification
  • ➤ Importance: Scale used for quantification of degree of functional limitation imposed by Congestive health failure (CHF)
  • ➤ (*Class IIIa No dyspnoea at rest; Class IIIb Dyspnoea at rest)

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman, who has been using the transdermal contraceptive patch as her primary method of contraception, presents to the outpatient department. She reports that her contraceptive patch was partially detached for more than 24 hours. Considering the potential compromise in the patch's effectiveness due to this incident, what would be the most appropriate advice for her to ensure continuous contraceptive protection?

options.label: A
options.text: To reapply the patch with another adhesive

options.label: C
options.text: To apply a new patch and use a condom for 1 week

options.label: D
options.text: To remove the patch and use a condom until her next menstrual period

questions.correct_answer: C. To apply a new patch and use a condom for 1 week
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) To apply a new patch and use a condom for 1 week

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In instances where the patch has been detached for an extended period, applying a new patch and using a backup contraceptive method, such as condoms, for the next 7 days is crucial to ensure ongoing contraceptive efficacy. This approach addresses both the immediate need for contraception and the potential gap in hormonal coverage due to the detachment.
  • ➤ In instances where the patch has been detached for an extended period, applying a new patch and using a backup contraceptive method, such as condoms, for the next 7 days is crucial to ensure ongoing contraceptive efficacy.
  • ➤ This approach addresses both the immediate need for contraception and the potential gap in hormonal coverage due to the detachment.

questions.text: A patient arrives at the emergency department with a hemorrhagic bullous lesion at the site of a dog bite. Which organism is most likely responsible for this type of severe skin infection?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Identify the maneuver shown in the image below:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Sellick’s maneuver

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sellick's maneuver, also known as cricoid pressure, is applied to the cricoid cartilage to prevent passive regurgitation of gastric contents during induction of anesthesia and is especially important in patients at risk of aspiration.
  • ➤ Sellick's maneuver, also known as cricoid pressure, is applied to the cricoid cartilage to prevent passive regurgitation of gastric contents during induction of anesthesia and is especially important in patients at risk of aspiration.

questions.text: A pediatric patient comes in with an infectious skin lesion on the leg. Culture of the lesion grows hemolytic colonies consisting of Gram-positive cocci in chains. Which test would be most appropriate to confirm the identity of the organism?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hemolytic colony with gram-positive cocci in chain is suggestive of β hemolytic Streptococcus. Bacitracin sensitivity is used to differentiate between β hemolytic Streptococci Group A- Bacitracin sensitive and Group b: Bacitracin resistant Bile solubility and Optochin sensitivity are used to differentiate Pneumococcus and S. Viridans Catalase test is used to differentiate Streptococcus and Staphylococcus.
  • ➤ Hemolytic colony with gram-positive cocci in chain is suggestive of β hemolytic Streptococcus.
  • ➤ Bacitracin sensitivity is used to differentiate between β hemolytic Streptococci Group A- Bacitracin sensitive and Group b: Bacitracin resistant
  • ➤ Bile solubility and Optochin sensitivity are used to differentiate Pneumococcus and S. Viridans
  • ➤ Catalase test is used to differentiate Streptococcus and Staphylococcus.

questions.text: During an autopsy, a forensic expert investigates the cause of death of an infant found under suspicious circumstances. To help determine if the infant was alive at the time of death, the expert decides to conduct Breslau's second life test. Which organ is primarily examined in this test?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Stomach

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Breslau's second life test involves examining the stomach and intestines.
  • ➤ Breslau's second life test involves examining the stomach and intestines.
  • ➤ Breslau's second life test

questions.text: A 67-year-old man undergoing a routine checkup is found to have serum alkaline phosphatase levels three times the upper limit of normal. Serum calcium, phosphorous concentrations, and liver function tests are normal. He is asymptomatic. What is the most probable cause of these findings?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ An isolated increase in alkaline phosphatase in an asymptomatic elderly patient, particularly with normal calcium, phosphorous, and liver function tests, is suggestive of Paget's disease of bone.
  • ➤ An isolated increase in alkaline phosphatase in an asymptomatic elderly patient, particularly with normal calcium, phosphorous, and liver function tests, is suggestive of Paget's disease of bone.

questions.text: In a case where dye-filled into the urinary bladder does not stain a pad placed in the vagina, but the pad is soaked with clear urine, what is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ureterovaginal fistula is crucial for diagnosis and treatment planning, particularly in cases where urine leaks without associated dye from the bladder, pointing directly to an abnormal connection involving the ureters rather than the bladder or urethra. This insight guides further diagnostic imaging and appropriate surgical intervention to correct the fistula.
  • ➤ Ureterovaginal fistula is crucial for diagnosis and treatment planning, particularly in cases where urine leaks without associated dye from the bladder, pointing directly to an abnormal connection involving the ureters rather than the bladder or urethra.
  • ➤ This insight guides further diagnostic imaging and appropriate surgical intervention to correct the fistula.

questions.text: A 25-year-old male presents to the clinic with gastrointestinal discomfort, diarrhea, and mild abdominal pain. He reports a history of camping. A stool sample is obtained, and on microscopic examination, an egg similar to the one pictured is observed. Which is the most likely mode of transmission and infective form of the parasite corresponding to this egg?

options.label: B
options.text: Ingestion of egg contaminated in water

questions.correct_answer: B. Ingestion of egg contaminated in water
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Egg of Trichuris trichiura - It spreads by ingestion of egg contaminated in water.
  • ➤ Egg of Trichuris trichiura - It spreads by ingestion of egg contaminated in water.

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents with progressive palmoplantar pigmentation. X-ray of spine shows calcification of IV disc. On adding benedicts reagent to urine, it gives greenish brown precipitate and blue-black supernatant fluid. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The clinical features of alkaptonuria, include palmoplantar pigmentation, calcification of intervertebral discs, and a characteristic color change of urine on standing or upon alkali addition. This metabolic disorder is diagnosed by the presence of homogentisic acid in the urine.
  • ➤ The clinical features of alkaptonuria, include palmoplantar pigmentation, calcification of intervertebral discs, and a characteristic color change of urine on standing or upon alkali addition.
  • ➤ This metabolic disorder is diagnosed by the presence of homogentisic acid in the urine.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman, para 6, experiences excessive bleeding post-vaginal delivery despite interventions including manual exploration, bimanual massage, intravenous oxytocin, and 0.2 mg methergine IV. What is the next step in managing this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Injection of PGF 2α (Prostaglandin F2 alpha)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ PGF 2α serves as an effective next step following the standard first-line treatments, offering a balance between efficacy and invasiveness, with an immediate impact on uterine tone.
  • ➤ PGF 2α serves as an effective next step following the standard first-line treatments, offering a balance between efficacy and invasiveness, with an immediate impact on uterine tone.

questions.text: When evaluating the prevalence of blindness using schools as the survey setting compared to broader population surveys, what is the likely impact on the estimation of blindness prevalence?

options.label: D
options.text: None of them is used for evaluation

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Underestimation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blindness situation in India: Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (Total): 11.2 per 1000 population Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (0-14 years): 0.1 per 1000 population Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (15-49 years): 0.6 per 1000 population Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (50+ years): 77.3 per 1000 population So if Schools are used where only refractive errors generally constitute blindness (that too very few are actually blind i.e. <3/60) AS COMPARED TO POPULATION (where age-related cataract constitute as major cause of blindness), it would lead to underestimation of prevalence of blindness in the country
  • ➤ Blindness situation in India: Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (Total): 11.2 per 1000 population Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (0-14 years): 0.1 per 1000 population Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (15-49 years): 0.6 per 1000 population Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (50+ years): 77.3 per 1000 population
  • ➤ Blindness situation in India:
  • ➤ Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (Total): 11.2 per 1000 population Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (0-14 years): 0.1 per 1000 population Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (15-49 years): 0.6 per 1000 population Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (50+ years): 77.3 per 1000 population
  • ➤ Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (Total): 11.2 per 1000 population
  • ➤ Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (0-14 years): 0.1 per 1000 population
  • ➤ Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (15-49 years): 0.6 per 1000 population
  • ➤ Estimated prevalence of Blindness in India (50+ years): 77.3 per 1000 population
  • ➤ So if Schools are used where only refractive errors generally constitute blindness (that too very few are actually blind i.e. <3/60) AS COMPARED TO POPULATION (where age-related cataract constitute as major cause of blindness), it would lead to underestimation of prevalence of blindness in the country

questions.text: A 40-year-old patient undergoing long-term steroid therapy complains of sudden severe pain in the right hip. What is the preferred imaging study to evaluate this complaint?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ MRI is the imaging modality of choice for evaluating suspected osteonecrosis in patients on long-term steroid therapy, due to its sensitivity in detecting early changes in the bone and marrow. It's crucial for early diagnosis and potential management to prevent further joint damage.
  • ➤ MRI is the imaging modality of choice for evaluating suspected osteonecrosis in patients on long-term steroid therapy, due to its sensitivity in detecting early changes in the bone and marrow.
  • ➤ It's crucial for early diagnosis and potential management to prevent further joint damage.

questions.text: Avoiding awareness of the pain of reality by negating sensory data is seen in which of the following defense mechanisms?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Denial specifically allows individuals to navigate painful realities by blocking acknowledgment of that reality, which can temporarily shield them from acute distress but may also prevent addressing and resolving underlying issues.
  • ➤ Denial specifically allows individuals to navigate painful realities by blocking acknowledgment of that reality, which can temporarily shield them from acute distress but may also prevent addressing and resolving underlying issues.

questions.text: A public health professional is designing a program aimed at the primary prevention of hypertension. Which of the following interventions are considered primary preventive measures to reduce the risk of developing hypertension? Weight reduction Dietary salt reduction Exercise promotion Early diagnosis Antihypertensive drugs
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1,2,3: Weight reduction, Dietary salt reduction, Exercise promotion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Early diagnosis, Antihypertensive drugs are Secondary level of prevention for Hypertension
  • ➤ Early diagnosis, Antihypertensive drugs are Secondary level of prevention for Hypertension

questions.text: A 60-year-old woman presents to OPD with complaint of itching in vagina, discharge from vagina and dyspareunia. Best treatment option would be:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Vaginal estrogen

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vaginal estrogen is the treatment of choice for relieving symptoms associated with atrophic changes in the vagina, such as itching, discharge, and dyspareunia.
  • ➤ Vaginal estrogen is the treatment of choice for relieving symptoms associated with atrophic changes in the vagina, such as itching, discharge, and dyspareunia.

questions.text: A healthcare facility manager is training new staff on infection control practices and the use of disinfectants. The manager emphasizes the importance of choosing appropriate agents for sterilization and the elimination of bacterial spores. Which of the listed agents are sporicidal? Glutaraldehyde Ethylene oxide Formaldehyde Benzalkonium chloride Chlorine
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sporicidal agents include:
  • ➤ Sporicidal agents include:
  • ➤ EFGH: Ethylene oxide, Formaldehyde, Glutaraldehyde, Hydrogen peroxide. 3P: Peracetic acid, O-Phthalic acid and Plasma sterilization. Autoclave, hot air oven and incineration.
  • ➤ EFGH: Ethylene oxide, Formaldehyde, Glutaraldehyde, Hydrogen peroxide.
  • ➤ 3P: Peracetic acid, O-Phthalic acid and Plasma sterilization.
  • ➤ Autoclave, hot air oven and incineration.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is NOT true regarding Psoriasis?

options.label: A
options.text: Nail pitting seen is of deep irregular & coarse type

options.label: C
options.text: Joint involvement is seen in 5-30% of patients

questions.correct_answer: D. Deficient Th1 & Th17 helper cells
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Psoriasis involves an overactive immune response mediated by T-cell subtypes, particularly Th1 and Th17, which leads to increased inflammation and skin cell turnover.
  • ➤ Psoriasis involves an overactive immune response mediated by T-cell subtypes, particularly Th1 and Th17, which leads to increased inflammation and skin cell turnover.
